subcontent: Professor of Empire Innovation and Endowed Chair in Health and Social Equity

content: The University at Albany, State University of New York, seeks to hire a Director of the newly formed University-wide Institute for the Achievement of Health and Social Equity; the Director will serve as Professor of Empire Innovation and Health and Social Equity Endowed Chair. The University is seeking an individual with expertise and a proven track-record as a health disparities scholar (open rank with a strong preference for a senior investigator), effective by the end of May 2022. This New York State supported position provides a 12-month appointment and a significant start-up package to advance a research program toward extramural research funding.

We seek to fill this position with an emphasis in the areas of health and social equity. While all outstanding scholars focused on health disparities are encouraged to apply, priority will be given to candidates with experience in health disparities research over the life course which could include the physical/built environment, the sociocultural environment, biological and behavioral health, the social determinants of health, and epigenetics, along with other related areas that address minority health inequality and minority health. A component of health disparities research and training that is often missing is the study of the links between socio-cultural factors, the environment and behavior, pathogenic pathways, and biological processes. New understandings along these domains of influence will be a crucial part of the holistic, transdisciplinary and lifespan approaches to health disparities research and the development of effective interventions in the years ahead.

The successful applicant will join a diverse scholarly community which celebrates the pursuit of new knowledge and discovery, enthusiastically supports collaborations between colleagues from different disciplines, and steadfastly highlights rigor in high-impact health disparities and social equity research and scholarship.

The University at Albany has a long tradition of excellence in health disparities research, training and transdisciplinary engagement with faculty scholars spanning nine colleges and schools, as demonstrated by its nationally acclaimed Center for the Elimination of Minority Health Disparities (CEMHD). The CEMHD is funded by the NIH’s National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities with distinguished awards including an NIMHD (R24) EXPORT Center, an NIMHD (P20) Center of Excellence, an NIMHD (S21) Health Disparities Endowment, and a Hearst Foundation Health Disparities grant. In recent years, the University at Albany established a minority health disparities engaged researchers’ community to accelerate and advance new research and discovery recognizing the nationwide critical importance of the public health challenge of minority health disparities – particularly in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.

The successful EIP/Endowed Chair candidate will be expected to lead the pursuit of extramural funding to support a robust research program, publish in relevant academic fields, and lead efforts that support expanded investment in this UAlbany area of strength and opportunity. Additionally, the successful candidate will be expected to serve the broader mission of the institution to educate, advance research and scholarly excellence, broaden community engagement, and create a more diverse and inclusive campus community.

Priority will be given to candidates able to engage in interdisciplinary and inter-institutional collaborations, especially across UAlbany’s colleges and schools (College of Arts and Sciences, School of Public Health, School of Social Welfare, College of Emergency Preparedness, Homeland Security and Cybersecurity, School of Education, the Rockefeller College of Public Affairs and Policy), and SUNY universities and colleges, along with current community and government partners such as the New York State Department of Health, and New York State Office of Children and Family Services.

Qualified candidates should submit a cover letter, a detailed curriculum vitae, and a statement of research and scholarship interests through Interview Exchange at: https://albany.interviewexchange.com/. Finalists will be asked to provide names and contact information of three (3) references.

The University at Albany fully supports diversity and inclusion. We strive to foster an environment that is inclusive, welcoming, and respectful to all. We seek to recruit and retain a diverse population of staff, students, and research scientists across the University. We work to share our research and training with diverse audiences locally, nationally, and globally. Applicants must address in their application their ability to work with and instruct a culturally diverse population.
Applications will be reviewed immediately with priority given to applications submitted by XXXX December 1, 2021 [30 days from date description approved].

For more information about this announcement, including deadlines and required documents, please refer to the Human Resources website at https://albany.interviewexchange.com/jobofferdetails or contact Dr. Theresa Pardo (tpardo@albany.edu, 518-442-3984).
The University at Albany is an EO/AA/IRCA/ADA Employer.
